reviews.review: The detail and storyline was great!

Just got home from the 9:15 showing of Frozen 2 on opening night. I cannot believe I'm saying this, but I am... I loved Frozen 2 even more than Frozen. The movie is sheer magic. It has a huge heart and is hilarious in spots. Also, the best 3D film I've ever seen.

Ever heard of Stendhal Syndrome? I was crying in the theater just overcome with emotion at how incredible the film was. Humans came together, worked together, to create this incredible piece of art. Yes. Art.

Go see it.  Also, stay through the credits... you don't want to miss Olaf's parting words.

Frozen 2 continues on the success of the original Frozen, with Idina Menzel and Kristen Bell reprising their roles as sisters Anna and Elsa. This time, they are again joined by Olaf, Kristoff, and Sven (Josh Gad and Jonathan Groff) on an adventure beyond their homeland of Arendelle in order to discover the origin of Elsa's magical powers and save their kingdom. While there isn't much new here, we do see Yelana (Martha Plimpton), the leader of the Northuldra tribe joined by tribe members Ryder (Jason Ritter), and Honeymaren (Rachel Matthews) who are brother and sister, both wants to bring peace to the enchanted forest and share Kristoff's love for reindeer. The Songs of Robert Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez are more than adequate, but there isn't quite a "Let It Snow" ear worm among the soundtrack and the score by Christophe Beck continues to add the the experience.

‪Oh man... the disappointment that is Frozen 2. It started so good and it just go in a very fast downfall all the way to an anticlimactic ending. ‬ The one star is the Cg is amazing! ‪I still like the Once upon a time version better. ‬

Way too many songs, boring, and way too much time on the snowman and just didn’t feel the same as the first movie . It felt way too long and the story was not necessary or didn’t really add anything super mega necessary to the first one. And even the songs don’t feel genuine, it just felt like a cd playing... the colors of the whole movie were nice though. But that’s about it. I did not enjoy this movie but I know it’s still going to make millions and millions. Very few, just like 2 or max 3 songs were nice but all the rest were just sooooo unnecessary.
I have to say I think I liked this sequel just as much or even more than the first!

As someone who was a fan of the first movie, I honestly have to say that this sequel didn't work for me. The story was weak, rushed and unnecessary and the characters all seemed to have learned nothing from the first movie.

On the upside the animation was breathtaking but that means nothing when your story just doesn't work.
A strong message to love and find yourself. It has dark and bright at times. Kristoff's song was the best surprise. Amazing movie!!
